intro: Chromolaena myriadenia, commonly known as the tropical weed or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it an invasive species in many regions. Its botanical features make it adaptable to a variety of environmental conditions.
